name: Classic Vegetable Fried Rice
preppingInstructions: If using leftover rice, break up any clumps with your hands or a fork. If using freshly cooked rice, spread it out on a tray to cool and dry slightly for about 15 minutes.
Dice the onion, carrot, and bell pepper into small, uniform pieces for even cooking.
Mince the garlic and chop the green onions, separating the white parts from the green.
instructions: Heat 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
Add the minced garlic and diced onion to the pan. Sauté for about 2 minutes until the onion becomes translucent and fragrant.
Add the diced carrot and bell pepper to the skillet. Stir-fry for another 3-4 minutes until the vegetables are tender but still crisp.

Push the vegetables to one side of the skillet. Add the remaining tablespoon of oil to the empty side and crack the eggs into the pan. Scramble the eggs until fully cooked, then mix them with the vegetables.
Add the cooked rice to the skillet, breaking up any clumps. Stir everything together, ensuring the rice is well mixed with the vegetables and eggs.
Pour the soy sauce over the rice mixture, and season with salt and black pepper. Stir-fry for an additional 3-4 minutes, allowing the rice to absorb the flavors and get slightly crispy.
Finally, add the green peas and chopped green onions (white parts) to the skillet. Stir-fry for another 1-2 minutes until the peas are heated through.
Taste and adjust seasoning if necessary. Serve hot, garnished with the remaining green onion tops.

name: Classic Chicken Teriyaki
preppingInstructions: Slice the chicken breast into bite-sized pieces, about 2.5 cm (1 inch) thick.
Mince the garlic cloves and grate the ginger.
Chop the green onions into thin slices, separating the white parts from the green tops.
instructions: In a bowl, combine soy sauce, mirin, sake, brown sugar, minced garlic, and grated ginger. Stir until the sugar is dissolved to create the teriyaki sauce.
Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.

Add the chicken pieces to the skillet in a single layer. Cook for about 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the chicken is browned and cooked through (internal temperature should reach 75°C or 165°F).
Pour the teriyaki sauce over the cooked chicken in the skillet. Stir to coat the chicken evenly and let it simmer for about 3-5 minutes until the sauce thickens slightly.
Remove from heat and sprinkle sesame seeds and the white parts of the green onions over the chicken. Stir to combine.
Serve the chicken teriyaki over steamed rice or with stir-fried vegetables, garnished with the green tops of the green onions.

name: Classic Bacon, Egg, and Cheese Sandwich
preppingInstructions: Gather all ingredients and kitchen tools: frying pan, spatula, and a knife.
Slice the English muffins in half and set aside.
Crack the eggs into a bowl and whisk them with salt and black pepper until well combined.
instructions: In a frying pan over medium heat, cook the bacon slices until crispy, about 4-5 minutes per side. Remove and place on a paper towel to drain excess fat.
In the same pan, reduce the heat to low and toast the English muffin halves cut-side down until golden brown, about 2-3 minutes. Remove and set aside.
Pour out excess bacon grease, leaving about 1 tablespoon in the pan. Add butter and let it melt.
Pour the whisked eggs into the pan, stirring gently with a spatula. Cook until the eggs are just set but still creamy, about 3-4 minutes.
Place a slice of cheddar cheese on top of the eggs and cover the pan for 1 minute to melt the cheese.

Assemble the sandwich: On the bottom half of each toasted English muffin, layer the crispy bacon, followed by the cheesy scrambled eggs. Add hot sauce if desired, then top with the other half of the muffin.
Serve immediately and enjoy your delicious bacon, egg, and cheese sandwich!

name: Classic Turkey Sandwich with Avocado and Spinach
preppingInstructions: Wash the fresh spinach leaves under cold water and pat them dry with a paper towel.
Slice the tomato into thin rounds.
Cut the avocado in half, remove the pit, and scoop the flesh out with a spoon. Slice the avocado into thin slices.
instructions: Lay out the slices of whole grain bread on a clean surface.
Spread 1 tablespoon of mayonnaise on two slices of bread and 1/2 tablespoon of mustard on the other two slices.
On the mayonnaise-spread slices, layer the sliced turkey breast evenly.
Add a layer of fresh spinach leaves on top of the turkey.
Place the sliced tomato on top of the spinach, followed by the sliced avocado.
Sprinkle a pinch of salt and black pepper over the avocado for added flavor.
Top with the mustard-spread slices of bread, pressing down gently to hold everything together.
Cut the sandwiches in half diagonally for a beautiful presentation and serve immediately.

name: Korean Fried Chicken
preppingInstructions: Rinse the chicken wings under cold water and pat them dry with paper towels.
In a large bowl, combine the all-purpose flour, cornstarch, baking powder, salt, black pepper, garlic powder, and ginger powder. Mix well.
Gradually add water to the dry ingredients, whisking until you have a smooth batter.
instructions: Heat the vegetable oil in a deep pot or fryer to 350°F (175°C).
Dip each chicken wing into the batter, allowing excess to drip off, then carefully place them in the hot oil.
Fry the wings in batches, making sure not to overcrowd the pot, for about 10-12 minutes or until golden brown and crispy.
Remove the wings from the oil and drain on paper towels.
In a separate bowl, mix together the gochujang, soy sauce, honey, and rice vinegar to create the sauce.
Toss the fried chicken wings in the sauce until well coated.
Serve hot, garnished with sesame seeds and chopped green onions.

name: Philly Cheese Steak
preppingInstructions: Thinly slice the ribeye steak against the grain into very thin strips.
Remove the seeds and membranes from the green bell pepper, then slice it into thin strips.
Peel and slice the onion into thin rings.
instructions: Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the sliced onions and bell peppers to the skillet. Sauté for about 5-7 minutes until they are softened and slightly caramelized. Remove them from the skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, add the sliced ribeye steak. Season with salt, black pepper, and garlic powder. Cook for about 3-5 minutes, stirring frequently, until the steak is browned and cooked through.
Return the sautéed onions and bell peppers to the skillet with the steak. Mix well to combine and heat through for another 2 minutes.

Divide the steak mixture into four portions in the skillet. Place two slices of provolone cheese on top of each portion. Cover the skillet with a lid for about 2 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
While the cheese is melting, lightly toast the hoagie rolls in a separate pan or under the broiler until golden brown.
Once the cheese has melted, use a spatula to scoop the steak and cheese mixture into the toasted hoagie rolls. Serve immediately.

name: Garlic Roasted Broccoli
preppingInstructions: Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
Wash the broccoli florets under cold water and pat them dry with a kitchen towel.
Peel and finely chop the garlic cloves.
instructions: In a large mixing bowl, combine the broccoli florets, olive oil, chopped garlic, salt, and black pepper. Toss until the broccoli is evenly coated.
Spread the broccoli mixture in a single layer on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Roast in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the broccoli is tender and slightly crispy on the edges, stirring halfway through for even cooking.
Remove the baking sheet from the oven and sprinkle the roasted broccoli with Parmesan cheese and drizzle with lemon juice.
Serve warm as a delicious side dish or a healthy snack. Enjoy!

name: Bacon Egg and Cheese
preppingInstructions: Gather all ingredients and cooking tools: a frying pan, spatula, and a plate for serving.
Slice the English muffins in half and set aside.
instructions: In a frying pan over medium heat, cook the bacon slices until crispy, about 5-7 minutes. Flip occasionally for even cooking.
Once cooked, remove the bacon from the pan and place it on a paper towel to drain excess grease.
In the same pan, reduce the heat to low and add the butter. Allow it to melt and coat the bottom of the pan.
Crack the eggs into the pan, being careful not to break the yolks. Sprinkle with salt and black pepper to taste.
Cook the eggs to your desired doneness: sunny-side up (about 2-3 minutes) or flip them for over-easy (about 1-2 minutes more).
Place a slice of cheddar cheese on top of each egg during the last minute of cooking to let it melt.
While the eggs are cooking, toast the English muffin halves in a toaster or on a separate pan until golden brown.
Assemble the sandwiches: on the bottom half of each muffin, layer two slices of bacon, followed by the cheesy egg. Top with the other half of the muffin.
If desired, drizzle with hot sauce before serving. Enjoy your delicious Bacon Egg and Cheese sandwiches!

name: Bacon Egg and Cheese
preppingInstructions: Gather all ingredients and cooking utensils.
Slice the English muffins in half and set aside.
instructions: In a skillet over medium heat, cook the bacon slices until crispy, about 5-7 minutes. Remove and place on paper towels to drain excess fat.

In the same skillet, reduce heat to low and crack the eggs into the pan. Sprinkle with salt and black pepper. Cook until the whites are set but the yolks are still runny, about 2-3 minutes. If you prefer your yolks cooked through, flip the eggs and cook for an additional minute.
While the eggs are cooking, toast the English muffins until golden brown.
Once the eggs are done, place a slice of cheddar cheese on top of each egg and cover the skillet for about 1 minute, or until the cheese is melted.

To assemble, spread butter on the toasted English muffin halves. Place two slices of bacon on each muffin half, followed by the cheesy egg. If desired, drizzle with hot sauce before topping with the other half of the muffin.

name: KFC Fried Chicken Homemade
preppingInstructions: In a large bowl, combine the chicken pieces and buttermilk. Ensure all pieces are well coated. Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours, preferably overnight.
instructions: In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the all-purpose flour, cornstarch, baking powder, salt, black pepper, paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, dried thyme, and cayenne pepper until well combined.
Remove the chicken from the buttermilk, allowing excess to drip off. Dredge each piece in the flour mixture, ensuring an even coating. Shake off any excess flour and set aside on a wire rack.

In a large, deep skillet or Dutch oven, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat until it reaches 175°C (350°F). You can test the oil by dropping a small amount of the flour mixture into it; if it sizzles, it's ready.

Carefully add the chicken pieces to the hot oil, being cautious not to overcrowd the pan. Fry in batches if necessary. Cook for about 15-18 minutes, turning occasionally, until the chicken is golden brown and cooked through (internal temperature should reach 75°C or 165°F).
Once cooked, transfer the chicken to a paper towel-lined plate to drain excess oil. Allow to rest for a few minutes before serving.

name: Chicken Teriyaki
preppingInstructions: Thinly slice the chicken breast into bite-sized pieces.
Mince the garlic and ginger finely.
Chop the green onions, separating the white parts from the green.
instructions: In a bowl, combine soy sauce, mirin, brown sugar, minced garlic, and ginger to create the teriyaki sauce.
Heat sesame oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the sliced chicken to the skillet and cook until browned and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes.
Pour the teriyaki sauce over the chicken and stir to coat evenly. Let it simmer for another 5 minutes until the sauce thickens slightly.
Serve the chicken teriyaki over cooked rice, garnished with chopped green onions and sesame seeds. Enjoy!

name: Pad Thai
preppingInstructions: Soak the rice noodles in warm water for about 30 minutes until they are soft, then drain and set aside.
Prepare the sauce by mixing tamarind paste, fish sauce, sugar, and lime juice in a small bowl. Stir until the sugar is dissolved.
Chop the green onions and crush the peanuts.
instructions: Heat 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
Add the minced garlic and sauté for about 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add the shrimp to the skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes until they turn pink and are cooked through. Remove the shrimp and set aside.
In the same skillet, add another tablespoon of oil and crack the eggs into the pan. Scramble them gently until just set, then add the soaked rice noodles and the prepared sauce.
Toss everything together for about 2-3 minutes until the noodles are well coated and heated through.
Add the cooked shrimp back into the skillet along with the bean sprouts and half of the green onions. Stir-fry for another minute until the bean sprouts are slightly wilted.
Serve hot, garnished with the remaining green onions and crushed peanuts.

name: Classic Meatballs
preppingInstructions: Preheat your oven to 200°C (400°F).
Finely chop the garlic and parsley.
instructions: In a large mixing bowl, combine the ground beef, breadcrumbs, grated Parmesan cheese, chopped garlic, chopped parsley, egg, salt, and black pepper.
Mix the ingredients with your hands until well combined, but do not overmix to keep the meatballs tender.
Shape the mixture into meatballs, about the size of a golf ball, and place them on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Drizzle olive oil over the meatballs to help them brown in the oven.
Bake the meatballs in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until they are cooked through and golden brown.
While the meatballs are baking, heat the tomato sauce in a saucepan over medium heat.
Once the meatballs are done, add them to the sauce and let them simmer for 5-10 minutes to absorb the flavors.
Serve the meatballs hot, garnished with additional parsley and grated Parmesan cheese if desired.
